intro: Rhagodia latifolia subsp. recta, commonly known as the broad-leaved rhagodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Rhagodia latifolia subsp. recta is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
